WRITING.TEXT: Not common here. It's +1 if you are married or living together, generally (all weddings ive attended have done this). And then all wedding party get a plus 1, regardless.

id say 7-8 months. My dress i purchased beginning of april, my wedding is november. its going to take 5 months to come in, so september. you want to give yourself time to get those fittings and a buffer juuuust in case it comes in later than expected.
i DIED with his rap horn impersonation. so awesome!
Morocco. We had an amazing trip there. I'd get married in the sahara or something!
haha me too, im def pear shaped. i also started lifting weights and its only made my booty bigger lol woe be our big bottoms!

yuuup. I am a size 4 in most things, reg street wear stuff. I get there, she takes my measurements "you're a 6 up top but a 10 with your hips... i suggest we order the 10 and take the top in." Im a what and a what now? And then i realized... its just wedding dress sizing. I felt really bad about it at first and then get over it real quick haha so dont let it bother you!
thank you! We're so excited about it, the venue itself is the thing im pumped the most for :)
was thinking the SAME THING as i was just listening again! haha man you read my mind :)

No that IS helpful, just to have an idea of what you're doing! Yeah my friend said when she walked it was a 10 second buffer before she came out (i was in her wedding...but i cant remember it haha). Im thinking 45 seconds is good. But its so hard to find a song that sounds good cutting off there or even fading out...

WRITING.TITLE: Realistically, How Long Should My Entrance Song Be?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm thinking of a million options (leaning towards Princess Leia's theme right now but who knows) and it's hard to think of just how long (or short) it will have to be. I am getting married in a 1920s park ave mansion, and the aisle is NOT long, not like a big church or anything. [This is the room we're getting married in](http://www.pratthouse.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/11/Wed-2.jpg). Obviously im not running down the aisle haha but... im really wondering realistically how much time i should be thinking of. For those with short aisles, how long did/are you planning your song to be?

At a wedding i went to that was outdoors, staff handed out these little plastic things you popped on to your heels. they were circular at the end, and kept you from sinking in. it was amazing. popped them off after when we went inside to reception and tossed them.

Not advice so much as a commiserating. Projects are dying down, i have plenty of leads but they either aren't as serious about hiring someone as they first seem, or in a recent instance, see my proposal and decide they don't have that much to allocate to a social media strategy and management... sometimes it's tough because people think that social media is "easy" and "Anyone can do it" so they dont know how to justify the cost of hiring outside.
Point is, im also in a dryspell, or stuck taking low paying work, which is really antithetical when im trying to increase my wages. I have 7 years of experience, im worth it, right?! Everyone tells me how impressive my portfolio is...no one wants to pay me for my experience.
Ugh. I feel you dude.
Man you've got a LOT done i such a short amount of time! congrats!
yeah ive been using the knot's checklist and feel on track if not a bit ahead!

WRITING.TITLE: November 18th, 2017 Brides... 200 Days! What Have You Done What's Left?
WRITING.TEXT:
I can't believe we're 200 days away. Time flies and we only were engaged in February! We've got all of our major vendors done, photographer, dj, caterer, florist, venue, officiant, and just got rehearsal dinner booked. We have some small items, like guestbook, signs, frames for the memorial table, cake toppers that are on the way. My dress was bought but won't be here until September. Save the dates are out, invitations will be ordered as soon as Mint.com has another sale. Working on getting the ladies to order/try on sample bridesmaid dresses! A lot of the things on my checklist are smaller things...decor items, thinking about time line, and then eventually we'll be thinking about seating charts soon!
Whew! So much! What are you guys up to in planning?
I love adding fruit and cinnamon to low fat cottage cheese. With cinnamon I can almost convince myself its rice pudding, plus it's full of protein!
omgosh its like the beauty and the beast rose. dying.
oh, how do you feel about blush fashion? ive been eyeing their items too!
oh i looove it!
haha also looking at SPARKLE! i think a sparkle cocktail dress might be a nice compromise.
Paisley Bridal in queens, if you're willing, has quite a vast selection! id call ahead of time to make sure but Im pretty sure they carry plus size!

WRITING.TITLE: How Fabulous Did You/Are You Dressing for Rehearsal Dinner?
WRITING.TEXT: FMIL has been finalizing rehearsal dinner booking and it got me thinking about what i want to wear (i know, its so far out but you know, ive got the time to think about it haha). A part of me wants to wear something amazeballs, but im wondering if wearing like...full length dress or something would be too over the top. Ive also eyed like, sequined Adrianna Papell cocktail dresses as well, thinking maybe thats less in your face. But at the same time... im only a bride once and want to sort of use it as an excuse to be fabulous. What are you all wearing? For context, i live in NYC and our rehearsal dinner is at a restaurant in the theater district, so im not concerned about it not fitting the venue, but just don't want to be dressed to the nines if its going to seem weird to others. I dunno what im talking about haha, maybe im just slightly introverted. ANYWAY TL;DR what are you wearing for your rehearsal dinner and is it simple or over the top fab? Would love to see!
oh wow thats AMAZING. id say you found it!
Michaels. Caught them on sale and got plenty of lovely ones for our memorial table, and some cheaper ones that are wood we can spray paint.
We're ring twinsies, except i have a sapphire!
I love #2!
I was put on viberzi for 2.5 months and it did nothing :-/ which was disappointing because for some people its been a miracle drug. but just didnt work for me.
oh i LOVE it! its def what i always envisioned my engagement ring would be. mine is very different and i still love it, but this is awesome!
That is SO reassuring to hear!

yeah that makes sense. we are going to have a rehearsal dinner the night before (actually going to the restaurant tonight to have dinner and see if we want to 100% book it!) so im going to check out the menu and what makes sense. for me. and that morning, it'll probably be plain oatmeal.
im already worried i can't commit to mine either! i might totally end up picking up a second pair haha. these are great though, and what a steal!
I lift and run 2-3 times a week. ALWAYS HUNGRY. ALWAYS.
i am on a low dose of Lexapro for it. It helps, but it doesn't solve the issue.
Our caterer here in NYC is 3x the price of our venue. its the one most expensive thing we're dealing with...but if im going to put $$ into anything, its food and photography!
very, very possible. i hear there are theories that IBS is caused by inflammation in some people.
i have take up 2-3 days of cardio and 2-3 days of weights since november and yes, it has helped quite a bit!
interesting! does it help with the pain itself, or do you find it honestly keeps you from going?

I actually learned i developed an allergy to red meat! so its completely out of my diet for over a year now. Other than that, i have a few known triggers, but also have been known to get sick even on "safe" foods.

love the idea of taking the walk on your own! the only other plus is im not shy about my issues, my bridesmaids and bridesmen know, so if worse comes to worse, i know they will help me feel better and support me.

WRITING.TITLE: Any Ladies With GI Issues? So Concerned About Wedding Day!
WRITING.TEXT: This might be TMI as it's fun tummy medical stuff, so if that makes you squeamish, you've been warned! I have IBS-D, was diagnosed with it almost 5 years ago, after ruling out crohns, celiacs, and a bunch of other things. It has been better now that I work freelance from home, and there's less stress. It's very much stress induced! So, im concerned about my wedding day. It's still 6.5 months away and it's all i can think about, running to the bathroom during the ceremony or something! I do take imodium when i dont feel well and id prepare to do it the night before, but even sometimes i still get sick despite taking it. Any other ladies in the same boat, or who have gotten married despite having any chronic GI illness? I need some tips or reassurance!
woo team sapphire! the cut is so unique, it's beautiful!
its been freezing and rainy for days here in NYC. it's been really weird weather lately.
My DJ offers ceremony music as part of the package, no extra charge, so we're doing it that way!
My balance sucks, and i can't get it right for bulgarian split squats. Been practicing at home, sans weights, with my stacked steps, but i still suck. So frustrating!
I dont sweat much either. Almost never with weights, even if im doing very little rests between. Yes when running, but only in specific spots (underboob area, back, thats it.)
My dad is paying for my dress, but it was 1695. With tax + shipping, 1895. Wont have it for another 4 months so not sure what alterations will be!
Also came to say same. We should all leave now.
over a week, but thats because they were moving offices. they informed me it would be delayed ahead of time, as well.

WRITING.TITLE: [For Hire] Social Media Manager Consultant
WRITING.TEXT: My name is Christine and I'm a social media consultant/manager/strategist. Located in NYC, can work remotely or within the NYC area. I have 7 years of experience as a social media manager, and have worked with everything from small local business to fortune 500 companies (Unilever, HBO, Netflix, Adult Swim). Looking to help any business with their social media presence, whether it's consultation and overall strategy for you to run, or if you need a day to day manager to take over responsibilities. I have a portfolio I can send you to give you an idea of my past work; please DM me if you need my skills!

WRITING.TITLE: [For Hire] Social Media Manager Consultant
WRITING.TEXT: My name is Christine and I'm a social media consultant/manager/strategist. Located in NYC, can work remotely or within the NYC area. I have 7 years of experience as a social media manager, and have worked with everything from small local business to fortune 500 companies. Looking to help any business with their social media presence, whether it's consultation and overall strategy for you to run, or if you need a day to day manager to take over responsibilities. I have a portfolio I can send you to give you an idea of my past work; please DM me if you need my skills!
Out offician told us to have 4 songs. The processional, then my own entrance, a song while we sign the license which she incorporates into the ceremony, then recessional
No, in store at Tiffanys!
woo Disney engagement! (i love disney, headed to WDW in 2 hours!).
Oh i love it! I wanted either green or blue; ended up with blue (Which is fine i love it!) but this is beautiful!
FH nailed it. I said i wanted either an emerald or sapphire ring; after doing research and learning emeralds are softer and better off as necklaces than rings, he nailed it with this beauty.

WRITING.TITLE: 212 Days! I can never get over how beautiful this is.

WRITING.TEXT: my fiance spots me ON the smith! Im not comfortable moving off it yet; we tried once and it was a disaster haha. but might try again next week!
We're using Ein Photography. Their portfolio is beautiful, if thats your style. I believe their packages start at 3600.

100% yes. I started gaining weight from muscle, and i freaked a little even though now i realize i look great. But, i have a history of anorexia in my past, and though ive been 10 years recovered, certain things cause me anxiety. so, i just said F you scale. Not looking at you anymore!

Im starting to see some awesome changes in my legs after 5 months of lifting. While my inner thighs touch now (always had a gap, even though im not crazy skinny) and thats taking some getting used to, my quads also look amazing from the side. You can see the bulk at the front. Im also running more than i ever have, and my calves are starting to take shape! if only my arms would catch up haha i have the worst upper arm strength, but i benched 50lbs yesterday, which was my highest so far. I've been doing it on the smith but i think soon ill be ready to take on the bar.
I know theres a fun trend of sharing wedding photos of family members, so like your parents, siblings, grandparents, etc. on their wedding days.
its amazing. i dont think its dated at all, and i think a great seamstress would be able to recommend things to make it look more up to date if you want.
My officiant will be asking my father for his love and support in our union, much in those words. No "giving away".
I was able to get past it loading the last save point, thankfully. Im sorry to hear that's not working for you. Hoping they patch it soon!

we've set up hotel blocks already which were attached to the website, which in turn was on the save the date. My FMILs family has already booked rooms, thankfully! But as for the rest, this is good advice. We'll definitely send them sooner than later!
having the same issue, just googled it and came across this thread. so annoying! it's just floating in the sky after destroying the second conduit.

I was HELLA nervous when i joined my first gym. I was HELLA nervous again joining my newest gym! And then AGAIN when i started lifting. the nerves are super normal, but you'll never do anything if you don't just fight them! My weight section is awesome, dudes don't say a damn thing to me, or even look at me. We are all just doing our own routine, save for when someone asks another to spot them. I also see women there a couple times a week, and that makes me feel more comfy.

Cereal. I love the stuff, i know its not great for you, but whatever guys. I LOVE IT. Still, i was def pouring myself like double the serving size every morning! also, milk. I used to eyeball a cup of milk...yeah def was more like a cup and a half! much better about it now by measuring it out, and so my fat intake is down a bit.
Everything, because I have IBS haha but...salads! For sure. I need to minimize their size otherwise i have not so fun poops the next day.

I drink syntha-6 Isolate in the chocolate milkshake flavor. with actual milk (or in your case, coconut milk) it tastes really freakin good! I too struggle to hit my protein every day, and this helps me a lot.

the top of my dress is all sequined beading, and in general the whole dress is pretty busy. so im keeping jewelry simple. Going to order [this necklace](https://www.etsy.com/listing/270357584/backdrop-bridal-necklace-back-drop?ref=shop_home_active_6) soon.
My FMIL is already asking who on my side is coming, and im like...we sent oout STDs, we don't send out invitations for a while so i dont know! calm down! haha

That's true. For us it's 50% traveling, 50% local (as in, tri-state area of CT, NY, and NJ so most driving in day of). So im wondering if early sept is enough time. Does it matter if they already have the save the dates? like wouldnt they already have an idea of they'd be planning to come?

WRITING.TITLE: When Did You/Are You Sending Out Invitations?
WRITING.TEXT: I see a lot of people here whose weddings aren't until late this year who are already ordering invitations, or discussing sending them out. But i also see conflicting info that you should send them out until 8-10 weeks prior. Im just curious, when are you all sending out invitations, or when did you? We just sent out save the dates, but i wasnt planning on sending invitations out until september.
Those are lovely! is that true gold foil printed on them?
I was engaged the day before you! Great weekend, huh? ;) that ring is AMAZING!

My FMIL keeps inviting friends. Friends that I have never met. But my FH has, and they are paying for the wedding, so i cant say much. I just hate the idea of a good 14 people being there and i have no idea who they are, and they arent even family. gah.

We added an extra hour to our reception for $1k (im in NYC, our prices are wildly high!). So it's 6-12am now. Granted mines a Saturday, but basically what one of the other posts said, that sunday is pretty much a saturday for you with the holiday. I say go for it!

What program did you use to create this? We are doing wedding a achievement cards (we are gamers) rather than programs and i need to create it myself.
Edit: fat fingers on mobile.
First one. So flattering and the back is amazing.

WRITING.TITLE: 30/F Want to Get Strong Before My Wedding and Beyond!
WRITING.TEXT: Looking for someone in a similar boat as me. First started heavy lifting 5 months ago, never a big gym goer until recently. Looking to not lose weight but reshape and get lean and fit! I want to look great for my wedding, but its not my only motivation. I started lifting long before i was engaged! I just want to be healthier in my 30s. 5'2, 116ish, putting on muscle but struggling to lose fat. Help me and be my buddy!
That's fair. im just not a late night person, ever! im in bed every night by midnight the LATEST and thats late for me. But maybe ill be rockin and rollin with adrenaline that day, we'll see!

We're doing a dessert table and a cake. We like the idea of having small desserts and coffee during reception, for the older folk, while im sure the younger ones will be dancing their butts off. And we'll have some of the desserts passed on the dance floor so those people dont miss out!

I dont want an afterparty, FH does. Our reception ends at midnight. That's enough for me! But it seems to be this new common trend of having people at the hotel suite afterwards. his friends party last year apparently didnt wrap up til 4 am. UGH. That sounds MISERABLE. I just want to enjoy being married and go to sleep afterwards!

no need to explain anything. when i declined one caterer who gave us a proposal for another, i wrote "I'm writing to let you know that we have decided to move forward with another caterer at our wedding this fall. FH and I greatly appreciate all of your work and time you've put into helping us plan our event, and I wanted to give you the heads up as to our decision."
Your dress is beautiful! i think the shoes will go well. And remember, chances are people won't even see them so definitely wear what you want!

Mens Warehouse fucked up my FH shirt on a rental...twice. He got it for a wedding he was in as an usher, and the day before the sleeves of the shirt, pants and jackets were hilariously long, despite the measurements they took. The morning of, they rushed him a new suit. Jacket pants fit...the shirt made him look like a pirate. The sleeves were huge, not just in length but in girth. I came separate from him on a shuttle, and had to bring him a regular ol white button down for him to slip into the bathroom and change into pre-ceremony, he was so embarrassed. Never again!
Love love love the third and the last one!
Im way far out but like, already "window" shopping for my rehearsal dress!
I have this idea that after the wedding, every once in a while im just gonna pull the dress out, put it on, and watch t.v. with a beer. like that friends episode.

Here was my personal interpretation. So, I thought about this [BHLDN dress](http://imgur.com/8fI0nPB) for a bit. Looked great on, very dreamy. But my venue is [this place](http://www.pratthouse.com/wedding/), and it's got a very 1920s, classic New York mansion vibe. And we're having an evening wedding. I ultimately chose [this dress](http://imgur.com/T0EjJJy) (which i was drawn to even BEFORE the BHLDN dress) because it "Fit the venue" but also, because it fit the time of day and the style of dress we're asking of our guests (formal). Not to say the BHLDN dress WASN'T formal, it just felt more "Whimsical outdoor ceremony" to me. Both choices are lovely, i just feel more confident on the one i chose fitting everything overall!

oh my god... that song IS awful. And the comments about crying when they heard it...yes, I cried, from laughter!
I agree, blame it on the DJ? An let the DJ in on it, like someone else recommended!
Luckily no surprises shoved our way yet, but I'm expecting them as time goes on.
welp, that just pushed me to send an email to get them to start adding dresses to the shareable showroom haha!
Im commenting because Im ALSO trying to figure this out! Wedding is November, we are also doing Azazie, and im wondering if we should be ordering samples for them to try on yet or if its too early!
it just comes naturally! It's a blessing and a curse...sometimes it drives my friends and FH insane haha

MY FH said "i dont know" for 2 years. but, it happened, now at almost 5 years together! It wasnt that he didnt want to marry me, he knew he did, but he wasnt ready for a variety of reasons.
I LOVE this subreddit. I just did a youtube rant (yeah im on youtube) about hating wedding forums and specifically about how they think honeyfunds are tacky (im firmly in the stop judging peoples wedding choices camp) and stated that this was the only place future brides should go.

We're paying 2450 for ours, but they are also handling ceremony, cocktail hour and dinner music. Basically we have them from 6pm to 12am. And we're in NYC. All that said, your deal sounds pretty reasonable!
Boom done. is going to be my new motto ;)
we are using the officiant who did my best friend's wedding last year. She was FABULOUS and all i could think was, when FH and I get married, i want her! We weren't even engaged yet!
Yiiikes! I hope you're doing better; screw that corset! Not worth it, not even a little bit!

yeah, agreed. i also dont want this to feel like a themed party, i want it to feel like an elegant 1920s wedding. we'll have touches of things that lean towards a bit of a flapper vibe, but for the most part our venue itself is carrying the whole thing (it was built in 1919) and we want it to still feel like a wedding, not some crazy theatrics!
I wouldn't even wear that to a cocktail attire wedding, let alone a black tie one. That's like my sunday brunch outfit. Maybe helping her go shopping will be a good way to handle it?
Buy that lottery ticket! What an AWESOME day!
1920s new york classic, but NOT a gatsby costume party.
omg. its ADORABLE! i always thought id do a tea length dress (so didnt haha) and if i did, it'd be something like this! i love it!

Just remember you are in a great position getting notice so far out! There are people who have wedding venues cancel like...months out. weeks out! I'm sorry that things are changing after you thought you were set, but i am hoping you find a winner in the 2 you are touring! keep us updated!

You and I have very similar engagement rings, except mine is sapphire center, diamonds on the side. I am also trying to find something that looks good with the ring, especially the shape of it! It hasnt been easy!

Im in NYC. Wedding in Manhattan, so premium prices basically :-/
Here's what my proposal said:
* Bridal Bouquet - $200-250 * Bridesmaids - $75 each * Boutonnieres - $15 each * Altar Arrangement - $500-$700 (we are doing two large pieces on two pedestals, pedestals provided by venue) * Hurricane candles for the aisle- $250 * Candles for our staircase in our venue - $200 * Dining Table Tall Arrangements - $250-$300 * Dining Table short arragements - $150-$200 * Delivery/Installation/Breakdown - $400
overall, this florist was still on the lower end of a few we looked at!

ah well if they are doing a big chunk of the set up, then you might have enough time. My venue is pretty much like "here, it's yours, figure it out" so all my individual vendors need time to set up! but i mean, seeing if you can even bump it to 2 hours won't hurt, especially to just add a buffer!
90 minutes seems so short! my venue gives 3 hours for set up. I wonder if they can give you any more than that.

I think it 100% depends on you and your personality, plus how much you feel a need to be involved. My best friend hired a wedding planner; just the thought of planning the wedding stressed her out, she and her now wife proscratinated a bunch, and realized they needed someone to basically get shit done for them. Me? People call me the most organized planner they know; naturally i want to plan EVERYTHING and im enjoying every moment of it! but i know thats not for everyone. I am still hiring a day of coordinator (more like, month of, as she'll be taking over things about 3-4 weeks out) so i can stop worrying when the time comes.
Stick to your guns. You arent unreasonable. Don't do it if you don't want to!

WRITING.TITLE: Clip on Earrings That Are Actually... Nice?
WRITING.TEXT: Hey guys! So, i dont have pierced ears. Did, twice, back in the day. Both times no matter the care they closed up very easily, so i gave up. I dont mind the idea of wearing clip ons for the wedding but its so hard to find clip ons that are actually...bridal. I've been searching etsy but have had a hard time. Any thoughts or suggestions?
